definition: to defend one's country
state of Wei (c. 1040-209 BC), vassal of Zhou
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense

sentences.english: It's the glorious duty for every soldier to defend our country against enemies.
sentences.chinese: 卫国抗敌是每个士兵应尽的光荣职责。

sentences.english: His heart desired this, so he decided to go to Shewei country and learn Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 他心中十分向往，便想去舍卫国观光并修学佛法。

sentences.english: Marshal Zhukov's contribution to the Great Patriotic War is unparalleled to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 朱可夫元帅为伟大卫国战争胜利做出的贡献无人能及。

sentences.english: At least the banks would not be holding the whole country hostage.
sentences.chinese: 至少银行就不能打着保家卫国的旗号，发国难财了。

sentences.english: His first priority was protecting the country.
sentences.chinese: 他的首要任务是保卫国家。

sentences.english: After the Great Patriotic War, the Soviet Union's nuclear fission research have no news.
sentences.chinese: 卫国战争爆发后，苏联核裂变研究陷入停滞。

sentences.english: But he that stands by it now, deserves the love and thanks of every man and woman.
sentences.chinese: 但真正挺身以卫国者，值得天下男女的爱及感谢。

sentences.english: In the state of Wei, he was besieged and almost killed since he was regarded mistakenly as Yanghu.
sentences.chinese: 在卫国，被人误认为阳虎而遭困，差点儿丢了老命。

sentences.english: The protection of the country is the sacred duty of every citizen.
sentences.chinese: 保卫国家是每个公民的神圣职责。

sentences.english: What Confucius said couldn't dissuade Yanhui yet. He went on saying, "I will be upright inside and deferential outside."
sentences.chinese: 颜回要去卫国的决心并没有因为老师这一席话而打消。

sentences.english: Your charge now is not only to protect our country, but to do what is right and just.
sentences.chinese: 你们的使命不仅是保家卫国，更是伸张正义。

sentences.english: They made a promise to our country to be its defenders.
sentences.chinese: 他们在保家卫国上做出许诺。

sentences.english: Women now have the ability to fight crime and defend their countries in war.
sentences.chinese: 女性如今有能力打击犯罪，更能在战时保家卫国。

sentences.english: Yao Weiguo of the "hope that the Morning", the entire screen is Pianleng gray tone.
sentences.chinese: 姚卫国的《希望的早晨》，整个画面是偏冷灰调子。

sentences.english: Some officials from Wei made a special trip to Chen to kill the two men.
sentences.chinese: 卫国的大臣特地到陈国去执法处死这两个人。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic  deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 这是肩负战略威慑职责的军事领袖们保家卫国的需要。

definition: the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
monarch
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the state of Ju, ancient Dongyi state
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Duke Xiang of Song (reigned 650-637 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
